name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week's "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose husband had a sexting affair. https://t.co/lJXpaU8FzG

name: TheAtlantic
text: In an exclusive interview, former President Barack Obama identifies the greatest threats to the American experiment, explains why he’s still hopeful, and opens up about his new book to @JeffreyGoldberg: https://t.co/HrqWaumsz7

name: TheAtlantic
text: Read the full interview here: https://t.co/H5DFmF4cAt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The lesson here is that the identitarian left must not labor under the impression that all Black and brown people share their sense of racism as an ultimate deal breaker," @JohnHMcWhorter writes: https://t.co/4rQhUexLin

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even after Trump leaves office, the desire to seek retribution, to nurse grievances, will remain. Those desires are corrosive to our political culture," @Peter_Wehner writes: https://t.co/hoq6Xn5det

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Obsessing over Trump, even as he burns out like a dying star, is emotionally unhealthy." @Peter_Wehner's latest:  https://t.co/YD1XE0JtMS

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @LoriGottlieb1: "Nobody *causes* her partner to cheat. There are much less destructive ways of managing marital issues, and he needs to take responsibility for the pain he’s created.”

This week ⁦@TheAtlantic⁩ : A healing process for recovering from an affair https://t.co/wjjtLMS8Cy

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JohnHMcWhorter: The identitarian left must not labor under the impression that re voting, all black and brown people share their sense of racism as an ultimate deal breaker. They rank it differently while hating it - a kind of sophistication.
https://t.co/vVScQW5Oy0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "I love Ta-Nehisi. I love his writing; I love him personally. He’s such a gracious, thoughtful, humble person. He’s a good-hearted person, very open-minded, trying to figure this stuff out. I think the world of him." -- @BarackObama:
https://t.co/sfRXiTHpeg

name: TheAtlantic
text: When it comes to Queen Elizabeth II, “The Crown” tends to forgive easily. But in its sharp and splashy fourth season, the drama stops treating the monarch as a faultless heroine, writes @shirklesxp: https://t.co/SSJJdTvXpH
